ai.summary: A 6.3 km moderate hike in the UK with varied terrain and gentle elevation. The route combines grassy tracks, rocky sections, and open moorland with rewarding views, suitable for walkers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including well-defined paths, exposed rocky stretches, damp/muddy patches and uneven ground. Expect grass, gravel, and potential boggy areas, plus wind on higher ground.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast before you go; UK conditions on moorland can change rapidly. Wear sturdy waterproof hiking boots and dress in layers; bring a waterproof jacket. Carry a map and compass or offline GPS; don't rely solely on a phone. Tell someone your planned route and expected return time. Stay on marked paths; be careful on wet rock and muddy patches. Carry enough water and snacks; bring a small first aid kit. Be prepared for wind and cold at elevation and daylight hours; consider a headlamp if finishing near dusk. Mobile coverage may be limited on open moorland; have a plan for emergencies. Turn back if visibility drops or weather deteriorates.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or offline GPS
